bug.short_desc: qx.ui.mobile.form.NumberField maximum and minimum validation broken

long_desc.thetext: NumberField checks and fixes text values on blur event but do not fixes invalid number values. Also form validation admits invalid number values. Check this sample http://tinyurl.com/cthl3jm

This is not a bug. You have to add a rule to the validation manager, before it is able to validate the form:
http://tinyurl.com/bupguoj

So for what do I need this field type at all is it does absolutely nothing? First I've talked not about form validation but about field behavior. Before if I set min and max values I could not enter values outside specified range in field, but now I can enter ANY numeric values - that's the bug I guess?
(In reply to comment #1) > This is not a bug. You have to add a rule to the validation manager, before it > is able to validate the form: > > http://tinyurl.com/bupguoj

The main benefit of the "qx.ui.mobile.form.NumberField" is, that it uses the new HTML5 input type : "number". This input type causes on iOS and Android devices that soft keyboard with number is shown.
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
